content:
I am using Thunderbird 140.6.0esr 64bit under Windows 11

I am dragging the names from the contacts sidebar directly to the BCC address line. I prefer to do this rather than right clicking and then selecting the BCC option.

A further quirk that I discovered today is that for a short while, no matter which name I clicked on in the sidebar, the only name/address that Thunderbird would copy was the very first one that I had copied, so I finished up after clicking on five names with five copies of whomever's name I had first clicked on. I then found that only if I first left clicked on the name and then right clicked and selected BCC - only then would the focus change to the new selection. So just right clicking did not change the focus.

I have been using Thunderbird for about 20 years now. I have run it under various versions of both Linux and Windows.
creator: jeremy40

content:
Testing: Windows 11

Process:

  1. Open +New Message/Write window
  2. Enable Contacts Sidebar
  3. Click on Bcc to get the Bcc line
  4. Select an address book
  5. Left click on any contact, hold down and drg over to Bcc and release mouse to drop contact. Please note - this does not highlight the contact.

Testing

Version 140.6.0esr Fails to drag and drop - Not just Bcc, drag and drop fails on To, Cc I'm seeing same as mentioned. It fails because the contact in Contacts Sidebar is not being auto selected/highlighted when you do the drag and drop.

Workaround until fixed. Make sure to select/ highlight the Contact in Contacts Sidebar and then do drag and drop and it works as expected.

Beta 147.0b3 and Daily 148.0a1 Drag and drop works as expected because contact is auto selected/highlighted


Reported bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=2008048
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Oh, and I have a lot of history in Local Folders. Hopefully that would be easy to copy over, once I figure out why it's not working to point it at the old data.

content:
The merge is going to be almost impossible. Unless all the recent mail is on the gmail server and can be downloaded again.

TO replace you current profile data with your old is by far the easiest and most reliable way to go forward. But that will remove what is in your profile now.

Other wise create a new profile to put you old mail into and then add the gmail account to that once you have the old mail situated.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
This is only a limitation to those that choose to use proprietary Microsoft products and protocols. I understand that work is progressing on a lot of exchange support but this is not the place to learn about road maps or future plans. I suggest you look at the published roadmap. https://developer.thunderbird.net/planning/roadmap

Note that the 2026 roadmap has not yet been published. and the 2025 has been removed. (I have no idea why so do not ask)

For those working in Microsoft shops, their employer provides the software from Microsoft that allows seamless management of information and integration via Microsoft office.

For the rest there is the cardbook addon. with the attendant Microsoft EAS extensions https://services.addons.thunderbird.net/En-gb/thunderbird/addon/eas-4-tbsync/

Davmail has been doing a good job or providing an exchange interface using standards compliant protocols for many years. It is probably 10 years since I last used it. But that was because I closed gown my exchange server, not because of issues with davmail.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Outlook calendar and contacts can be synced in TB 140ESR with the TbSync/Provider for EAS add-ons. When you add the account, select MS Office 365 (see picture).
creator: sfhowes

content: They are published on the AOL website. To be clear they are not "for Thunderbird" email providers simply publish the settings you need to use to access their mail servers using mail protocols. They are the same regardless of the mail client. Excluding android style Apps which are glorified webpages and often use the same protocols as webmail. See https://help.aol.com/articles/how-do-i-use-other-email-applications-to-send-and-receive-my-aol-mail
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
The correct settings are:

imap.aol.com, 993, SSL/TLS, OAuth2, email address

smtp.aol.com, 465, SSL/TLS, OAuth2, email address

Check the authentication method (OAuth2) and that the AOL account is sending on the smtp with a matching User Name, not another or 'Default' smtp.
creator: sfhowes
